dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4893 IH: National Guard and Reserve Student Loan Fairness Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Magaziner (for himself and Mr. Kelly of Mississippi) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to ensure that members of the reserve components of the Armed Forces receive appropriate credit toward public service loan forgiveness, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Guard and Reserve Student Loan Fairness Act.

section.header: Special rule for members of the reserve components of the Armed Forces performing certain duty
section.text: Section 455(m) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087e(m)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Special rule for members of the reserve components of the Armed Forces performing certain duty

subparagraph.header: Calculation of qualifying payments based on years of service creditable toward retired pay
subparagraph.text: With respect to a borrower who is a member of a reserve component of an Armed Force, the Secretary shall—

clause.text: in the case of a member who completed a full year of covered service, deem each month in such year to be a month for which a qualifying payment was made under paragraph (1) if—

subclause.text: for each such month the borrower made a corresponding monthly payment on an eligible Federal Direct Loan; and

item.text: met the requirements of paragraph (1); or

in the case of a borrower not employed full-time in a public service job at the time the payment was made, such payment would have met the requirements of paragraph (1) had the borrower been employed full-time in a public service job at the time of such payment.

clause.text: in the case of a member who completed a partial year of covered service, deem up to six months in such year to be a month for which a qualifying payment was made if—

subclause.text: for each such month the borrower made a corresponding monthly payment on an eligible Federal Direct Loan; and

item.text: met the requirements of paragraph (1); or

in the case of a borrower not employed full-time in a public service job at the time the payment was made, such payment would have met the requirements of paragraph (1) had the borrower been employed full-time in a public service job at the time of such payment.

subparagraph.text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this paragraph, and on an annual basis thereafter, the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Education shall jointly complete a data matching process—

clause.text: to identify each individual who, while serving member of a reserve component of an Armed Force, made one or more student loan payments eligible to be counted under this paragraph; and
without requiring further information or action from such individual—

subclause.text: to certify the total number of full or partial years of covered service of such individual; and
to count the total number of qualifying payments made by the individual during such years.

clause.text: The term full year of covered service means any year for which a member of a reserve component of an Armed Force was credited at least 80 points toward eligibility for retired pay under section 12732(a)(2) of title 10, United States Code.

The term partial year of covered service means any year for which a member of a reserve component of an Armed Force was credited at least 50 but less than 80 points toward eligibility for retired pay under section 12732(a)(2) of title 10, United States Code.
The term Armed Force has the meaning given that term in section 101 of title 10, United States Code.
